New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit his 47th home run and 48th steal, tying him for third on the Dodgers' single-season home run list behind only Shawn Green (40 in 2001) and Adrian Beltre (48 in 2004).
Key Match Events: The Dodgers hit four home runs in the first inning, including Shohei Ohtani's sixth leadoff homer of the season. Tommy Edman hit two home runs, one from each side of the plate, and Will Smith and Max Muncy also homered. The Cubs tied the game in the fifth inning with Cody Bellinger's three-run home run and Pete Crow-Armstrong's RBI single. The Dodgers won in the seventh inning with a tiebreaking hit from Gavin Lux.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers remained five games up on the Arizona Diamondbacks in the NL West and moved 5 1/2 games ahead of the San Diego Padres. The Cubs fell five games behind the New York Mets in the chase for the NL wild-card spot.
